introduction: In this video, we dive deep into the reasons why selecting all columns with the SQL command 'SELECT *' can be slow. We discuss the page-based structure of databases, the file system, and the operating system, and how reading pages from disk involves multiple operations. We also explore how the database cache, known as shared buffers, can improve performance.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding Databases and Pages
content: Explanation of how databases store rows in fixed-size pages.
Discussion of the concept of a page in the context of databases and how it differs from other uses of the term.
Explanation of how the size of a page can affect performance.
Introduction of the concept of page scanning and its impact on query performance.

sections.title: Section 2: Reading Pages from Disk
content: Explanation of how reading from disk involves multiple operations.
Discussion of the impact of the file system on performance.
Explanation of the concept of a file descriptor and its role in reading data.
Introduction of the concept of block size and its impact on performance.

sections.title: Section 3: Database Cache and Shared Buffers
content: Explanation of the concept of a cache in databases.
Discussion of the role of shared buffers in improving performance.
Explanation of how shared buffers work and their impact on query performance.
Introduction of the concept of a write-back cache and its role in performance.

sections.title: Section 4: Optimizing Query Performance
content: Discussion of the importance of optimizing queries for better performance.
Explanation of how to use indexes to improve query performance.
Introduction of the concept of query optimization and its impact on performance.
Explanation of the role of database statistics in query optimization.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Summary of the key points discussed in the video.
Discussion of the importance of understanding database performance and its impact on overall system performance.
Explanation of how to improve query performance by optimizing database structures and query methods.
Conclusion on the importance of monitoring and analyzing database performance for better system efficiency.
